data.title: Pickup Dinner
data.text: My friend and I could not come with any ideas for dinner. Since we live close by, I suggested C J's. I ordered the oxtail dinner which come with rice and two sides. I also ordered the 5 pieces of Snapper dinner which comes with fries and coleslaw. My friend enjoyed the oxtail dinner while I enjoyed the snapper dinner. Everything was very tasty.

data.title: Not the place for people on a trip
data.text: I chose this soul-food joint for me and my friends because it is close to Amtrak, but, really, it is nothing to recommend to a tourist or a visitor. That is my advice. The walls are grimy, the tv is loud, and the food, while quite tasty, is very expensive for such a dump. It is not really a restaurant: It is a neighborhood take-out stand with  three small tables, so the place seats six. No silverware; just plastic. Paper napkins. The woman who works there, Renée, is very grumpy until you warm her up with some jollying. She is very deficient in explaining just how to order and just what you get. You buy your soft drinks or water, extra, from a vending machine.

data.title: Best BBQ and Awesome Sauce
data.text: CJ's Barbecue and Fish is absolutely delicious! I eat quite often but not as often as I would like because the prices are too much for my budget.  The sweet and tangy BBQ sauce is the highlight of the meal.  The portions are also generous.

data.title: Great Food and Friendly people
data.text: It was my first time going there. I found them online. The ribs were delicious and tender.  BBQ sauce was very tasty and to mention the side dish of potato salad it was exceptionally good. I will be back when i come  to Richmond Ca. Thanks CJ's it was a delight to eat at your establishment.  Susie J. Seattle WA.

data.title: Good food
data.text: This is the quintessential neighborhood barbecue joint.  They have a lot of selections, both barbecue and fish.  The food is better than average, probably the one of the best in the immediate area.  The service can be a little spotty, but what do you expect for a neighborhood carry-out barbecue joint????

data.title: Eh
data.text: I tried their sliced beef with the spicier of the two sauces and the baked beans. Overall I was disappointed with the meal. The beef was cut up into tiny little chunks and then smothered with bbq sauce. There was too much sauce on the meat and the meat was very chewy and dry. The baked beans weren't amazing either. I've had better beans out of a can.
